title: Go back to 3.0 alpha tools and disable aapt2
message:
Go back to 3.0 alpha tools and disable aapt2

The crash was caused by aapt2 - it should be fixed in the next release

title: Downgrade the gradle tools to the latest stable version
message:
Downgrade the gradle tools to the latest stable version

The 3.0 alphas break the app for < Android 5.0 devices due to vector
drawable breakage.

title: Fix grabbing logs on N+
message:
Fix grabbing logs on N+

As of Android N, sharing file:// URIs is not allowed, instead switch to the FileProvider

title: Remove all the 'Root Path' stuff
message:
Remove all the 'Root Path' stuff

Since we now stream the input from the shell through Java to the output files,
this is no longer needed.

title: Update the LiveLogcatActivity to use the new logcat-specific term session
message: Update the LiveLogcatActivity to use the new logcat-specific term session

title: Customize the TerminalView to show logcat output only
message:
Customize the TerminalView to show logcat output only

I modified the TermSession to use libsuperuser to run logcat,
and show each line as soon as it comes. By skipping the whole buffer and character reading,
preformance is significantly faster.
Also, I stripped the writing to the process commands because they aren't used in this use case

title: Use a background thread to get logs
message:
Use a background thread to get logs

When finished, publish results to the EventBus

title: Update the Android gradle tools for instant run
message: Update the Android gradle tools for instant run

title: Fix detecting errors creating directory
message:
Fix detecting errors creating directory

Thanks to nels83 via issue #15

title: Rewrite how logs are captured
message:
Rewrite how logs are captured

Before logs were copied either by shell commands or redirection, which made the app dependent
on knowing how to access the external storage via both user and root context.
Now, run the commands and grab/write the output in the Java userspace code, whcih eliminates the whole need
for the 'root path'

Currently, the app thinks theres an error eaach time you run the app - this needs to be fixed

title: Make sure that mTermSession can't be null
message: Make sure that mTermSession can't be null

title: Remove the -C option from logcat
message:
Remove the -C option from logcat

It looks like this isn't a standard logcat option. :(

title: Add workaround for adoptable storage on M
message:
Add workaround for adoptable storage on M

Because you can adopt a SD card or whatever as your internal storage on M,
my old way of determining root paths doesn't always work.
It looks like the default path works fine, at least on CyanogenMod 13.0

title: Compatibility fixes for 4.3
message:
Compatibility fixes for 4.3

SU on 4.3 is very different, especially with regards to the
default storage (Mount namespaces). Work around this by using
the full path, and chowning the files to the proper user/group
afterwards.
